entities.name: ATLANTIS
entities.description: A legendary island first mentioned by Plato, described as a powerful and advanced civilization that existed around 11,000 years ago, located beyond the Pillars of Hercules, rich in resources, and possessing advanced technology and military power. It is said to have been destroyed in a catastrophic event, disappearing beneath the sea in a single day and night

entities.name: PLATO
entities.description: Ancient Greek philosopher who first mentioned Atlantis in his dialogues "Timaeus" and "Critias," describing it as a powerful and advanced civilization that existed around 9,000 years before his time

entities.name: TIMAEUS
entities.description: One of Plato's dialogues where the story of Atlantis is first mentioned, discussing the island's history and its eventual destruction

entities.name: CRITIAS
entities.description: Another of Plato's dialogues where the story of Atlantis is further elaborated, providing more details about the island's society and its downfall

entities.name: PILLARS OF HERCULES
entities.description: The modern-day Strait of Gibraltar, which, according to Plato, marked the boundary beyond which Atlantis was located

entities.name: ATLANTIC OCEAN
entities.description: A proposed location for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on interpretations of Plato's descriptions

entities.name: MEDITERRANEAN SEA
entities.description: Another proposed location for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on various theories and interpretations

entities.name: ANTARCTICA
entities.description: A less conventional proposed location for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on some speculative theories

entities.name: ATLANTEANS
entities.description: The inhabitants of the legendary island of Atlantis, described as a noble and virtuous people who eventually became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall

entities.name: DESTRUCTION OF ATLANTIS
entities.description: The catastrophic event described by Plato where the island of Atlantis was swallowed by the sea in a single day and night, leading to its disappearance

relations: Plato is the ancient Greek philosopher who first mentioned Atlantis in his dialogues, describing it as a powerful and advanced civilization
The dialogue "Timaeus" is where Plato first introduces the story of Atlantis, describing its history and eventual destruction
The dialogue "Critias" provides more detailed information about Atlantis, including its society and the reasons for its downfall
According to Plato, Atlantis was located beyond the Pillars of Hercules, which are identified as the modern-day Strait of Gibraltar
The Atlantic Ocean is one of the proposed locations for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on interpretations of Plato's descriptions
The Mediterranean Sea is another proposed location for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on various theories and interpretations
Antarctica is a less conventional proposed location for the legendary island of Atlantis, based on some speculative theories
Atlantis was the home of the Atlanteans, a noble and virtuous people who eventually became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall
The island of Atlantis was destroyed in a catastrophic event, as described by Plato, where it was swallowed by the sea in a single day and night
Plato describes the catastrophic destruction of Atlantis, where the island was swallowed by the sea in a single day and night
Plato describes the Atlanteans as a noble and virtuous people who eventually became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall
The Pillars of Hercules are identified as the modern-day Strait of Gibraltar, marking the boundary beyond which Atlantis was located
The Atlanteans, the inhabitants of Atlantis, were destroyed along with their island in a catastrophic event, as described by Plato
